name: John S. LITCHFIELD and Christie Litchfield, husband and wife v. COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION, Woodward Township and Daniel Jackson, t/d/b/a Dan's Auto Repair and Sales v. Ashley P. MOYER. Appeal of COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION

parties: John S. LITCHFIELD and Christie Litchfield, husband and wife v. COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION, Woodward Township and Daniel Jackson, t/d/b/a Dan’s Auto Repair and Sales v. Ashley P. MOYER. Appeal of COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
Appeal dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
NIX, C. J., and NEWMAN, J., did not participate in the consideration or decision of this case.
ZAPPALA and CASTILLE, JJ., dissent.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Jay W. Stark, for Dept, of Transp.
Raymond E. Ginn, Jr., for Litchfield et ux.
casebody.head_matter:
675 A.2d 1210
John S. LITCHFIELD and Christie Litchfield, husband and wife v. COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION, Woodward Township and Daniel Jackson, t/d/b/a Dan’s Auto Repair and Sales v. Ashley P. MOYER. Appeal of COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued May 1, 1996.
Decided May 17, 1996.
Jay W. Stark, for Dept, of Transp.
Raymond E. Ginn, Jr., for Litchfield et ux.
Bret J. Southard, for Moyer.
Before FLAHERTY, ZAPPALA, CAPPY, CASTILLE and NIGRO, JJ.
